author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) on Friday evening released its first list of 54 candidates who would contest the Assembly election.

Prominent among the contestants are the party’s national secretary H. Raja and Tamil Nadu unit vice president Vanathi Srinivasan.

The list was released in New Delhi after a party consultation meeting.

The BJP, which remained isolated in the Dravidian State between 2006 and 2013 managed to form a third front under the banner of the National Democratic Alliance to face the last Lok Sabha elections. However, the alliance disintegrated shortly after the formation of the Narendra Modi Government.

In the run-up to this Assembly elections, the BJP desperately wooed its erstwhile allies, the DMDK and the PMK, which had long ago announced its youth wing leader Anbumani Ramadoss as the chief ministerial candidate. However, its bid to revive the NDA failed as the PMK and DMDK insisted that they would lead the alliance.

In fact, DMDK leader Vijayakant had refused to meet senior BJP leaders who had flown down from New Delhi. Earlier this week, he decided to lead an alliance of which the four-party People’s Welfare Front is a constituent.

Following this, the BJP put up a brave face and announced that it would go it alone.

The BJP is the second party to announce candidates for the Assembly election.

Earlier, Naam Tamilar Katchi had announced candidates for all the 234 constituencies.

title: BJP releases first list of 54 candidates
